original_title: Sri Lanka MP Mayantha Dissanayake resigns as COPF chair after controversy
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Days after his appointment by majority, Sri Lanka main opposition Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Mayantha Dissanayake has stepped down as chairman of the parliamentary Committee on Public Finance (COPF) after his SJB colleagues cried foul over his appointment.
Dissanayake told reporters Monday February 27 that he would inform Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena in writing that he was resigning from the post.
The MP said that parliamentarians had called him last week and asked him if he would take the COPF chair if there was unanimous agreement.
“I was always true to my conscience. Last week when I was approached about taking the COPF chairmanship, I said I would do it if there was common agreement,” he said.
Dissanayake’s SJB colleague and former COPF chair Harsha de Silva was removed from the position, with Dissanayake appointed in his place, leading to some controversy within the SJB.

MP de Silva tweeted Thursday February 23 afternoon that all government MPs have backed the appointment of Dissanayake overruling the former’s original appointment.
“Goes to show how low people can go,” the economist-turned-politician said.
Dissanayake said he spoke to the Speaker Monday morning and decided to step down.
“I’m doing this because we must come to a consensus and carry out the responsibilities of the opposition as one party under the opposition leader,” he said. (Colombo/Feb27/2023)
